benchmark_details.name: NursingPiles
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces a novel Chinese nursing dataset called 'NursingPiles' aimed at enhancing large language model performance in nursing and elderly care tasks and establishes a benchmark test set for evaluating nursing knowledge and skills.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop AI-driven solutions tailored to nursing and elderly care, utilizing large language models for patient monitoring and personalized care.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is primarily Chinese-focused, limiting broader applicability across languages and cultures.

data.source: Developed from textbooks, manuals, legal documents, and research papers.
data.annotation: Automatically annotated through data processing pipeline.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on evaluation of models through established nursing exam questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in nursing knowledge assessments.
methodology.baseline_results: GLM4-Chat 9B + IPT + SFT achieved Precision of 86.78%, Recall of 85.65%, F1-score of 86.21%, and Accuracy of 58.9%.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through tests against authoritative nursing exam questions.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data is anonymized to protect participant confidentiality.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset is released under an open-source license (e.g., CC BY-NC 4.0) for non-commercial research.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent was obtained from research team members for data collection.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The research complies with applicable laws and regulations.
